title: S. F. Brownrigg
text:
Sherald Fergus Brownrigg (September 30, 1937 – September 20, 1996) was an American film director and producer.
Biography.
Sherald Fergus Brownrigg was born September 30, 1937 in <a href="El%20Dorado%2C%20Arkansas">El Dorado, Arkansas</a>.
During the 1970s he directed several low budget <a href="horror%20film">horror film</a>s, such as "<a href="The%20Forgotten%20%281973%20film%29">Don't Look in the Basement</a>" (1973), "<a href="Don%27t%20Open%20the%20Door%21">Don't Open the Door!</a>" (1974), and "<a href="Scum%20of%20the%20Earth%20%281974%20film%29">Poor White Trash Part II</a>" (1974). 
In 2001, a reviewer for the "<a href="Michigan%20Daily">Michigan Daily</a>" called "Poor White Trash Part II" "the worst movie of all time." Other commentators value Brownrigg's work for his ability to create thrills with a minuscule budget.
